abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Emergency Natural Gas
            System Reconstruction Project is rated as satisfactory. The
            key lessons learned include: a) The project demonstrated
            that a strong Project Implementation Unit (PIU) within the
            beneficiary can bring about successful and timely project
            implementation. Factors contributing to the effectiveness of
            the PIU were : appointment of highly qualified staff to
            manage the PIU; adequate quality, quantity, and continuity
            of staff; and sufficient autonomy. b) Adequate attention
            needs to be provided to financial and institutional
            objectives under emergency projects to ensure these are
            achieved. This requires the involvement of Government in
            identifying how it can best help achieve these objectives
            and its support for the overall financial and institutional
            development of the implementing agency.
